title: NC Democrats’ parity in Congress delegation may be fleeting
shortDescription: RALEIGH, N.C. (AP) — Democrats celebrated winning what was billed as North Carolina's lone toss-up race for the U.S. House this month, as state Sen. Wiley Nickel’s narrow victory over Republican Bo Hines in the 13th Congressional District helped weaken any national GOP midterm wave.

title: Election conspiracists claim some races for local offices
shortDescription: As voting experts cheered the losses of election conspiracy theorists in numerous high-profile races on Election Day, Paddy McGuire prepared to hand over his office to one of them.

title: Democratic U.S. Rep. Gomez triumphs in California district
shortDescription: LOS ANGELES (AP) — Democratic U.S. Rep. Jimmy Gomez defeated rival Democrat David Kim on Saturday in a Los Angeles district after a battle on the party’s progressive flank.With nearly all the ballots counted, Gomez had 51.3% to 48.7% for Kim, or a margin of about 3,000 votes.

title: House GOP pushes Hunter Biden probe despite thin majority
Walker, Kemp campaign in Ga. together for the 1st time
shortDescription: SMYRNA, Ga. (AP) — Fresh off his commanding reelection, Georgia Gov. Brian Kemp on Saturday played the role of dutiful Republican soldier as he campaigned for the first time alongside Senate hopeful Herschel Walker after spending months steering clear of his ticket-mate.

title: Officials: Georgia audit confirms secretary of state winner
shortDescription: ATLANTA (AP) — A hand count of random batches of votes in Georgia's recent election for secretary of state has confirmed Republican Brad Raffensperger's victory, state election officials said.The audit — required by state law — turned up a small difference in votes from the machine count used during the election, but the difference was well within the expected margin of error, the Secretary of State's office announced Friday.

title: Jeffries makes historic bid to lead House Dems after Pelosi
shortDescription: NEW YORK (AP) — A day after Speaker Nancy Pelosi announced she would step aside, Rep.

title: Trump 2024 rivals court his donors at big Las Vegas meeting
shortDescription: LAS VEGAS (AP) — The Republican Party's nascent 2024 class, emboldened as ever, openly cast Donald Trump as "a loser” over and over on Friday as they courted donors and activists fretting about the GOP's future under the former president's leadership.

title: Election certification avoiding chaos, except in Arizona
shortDescription: SANTA FE, N.M. (AP) — Certification of this year's midterm election results appears to be proceeding smoothly with little controversy across the country, with a small Arizona county being a rare exception, calming fears that local commissions consumed by talk of election conspiracies would create chaos by refusing to validate the will of the voters.

title: Frisch concedes race against Boebert as it goes to recount
shortDescription: DENVER (AP) — While conceding his tight U.S. House race to Republican Lauren Boebert, Democrat Adam Frisch said on Friday that his surprisingly strong campaign showed just how tired many GOP voters are of Boebert's brash style.

title: Difficulties again put Houston at center of Texas elections
shortDescription: HOUSTON (AP) — A Democrat who is the top official in Texas' largest county on Thursday acknowledged problems around Houston on Election Day that included paper ballot shortages and delayed openings of polling locations, but waved off an unfolding investigation by state police as political.

title: The AP Interview: Whitmer has ‘no interest in going to DC’
shortDescription: LANSING, Mich. (AP) — Fresh off a commanding reelection victory in one of the nation's premier swing states, Democratic Michigan Gov. Gretchen Whitmer says she will remain focused on her post and not growing speculation she could mount a future presidential run.

title: US House win by ex-combat pilot cements Republican control
shortDescription: LOS ANGELES (AP) — Republican Rep. Mike Garcia, a former Navy fighter pilot, scored a U.S. House win in a strongly Democratic district Wednesday, handing the GOP control of the chamber and giving the party a rare reason to celebrate in a state dominated by Democrats.

title: Walker, Republicans look for party unity in Georgia runoff
shortDescription: AUGUSTA, Ga. (AP) — Republicans insist they're working together to help Herschel Walker unseat Democratic Sen. Raphael Warnock in a Georgia runoff that offers the GOP a chance to finish a disappointing midterm election season with a victory.

title: ‘Democracy voters’ delivered for Democrats in tightest races
shortDescription: WASHINGTON (AP) — President Joe Biden tried to shape the midterm elections not as a verdict on his time in office, but rather on the contrast between Democrats and Republicans on American democracy.

title: Leading Republicans try to ignore Trump campaign launch
shortDescription: TALLAHASSEE, Fla. (AP) — Leading Republican officials on Wednesday sought to ignore Donald Trump's formal step into the 2024 presidential contest, insisting there were more pressing priorities as GOP leaders grappled with the fallout of a major midterm disappointment.

title: Same-sex marriage legislation clears key Senate hurdle
shortDescription: WASHINGTON (AP) — Legislation to protect same-sex and interracial marriages crossed a major Senate hurdle Wednesday, putting Congress on track to take the historic step of ensuring that such unions are enshrined in federal law.

title: Faith groups split over bill to protect same-sex marriage
shortDescription: Among U.S. faith leaders and denominations, there are sharp differences over the bill advancing in the Senate that would protect same-sex and interracial marriages in federal law. The measure, a high priority for congressional Democrats, won a key test vote Wednesday when 12 Senate Republicans joined all Democrats to forward the bill for a final vote in the coming days.

title: Storming Capitol was ‘really stupid,’ Oath Keeper testifies
shortDescription: WASHINGTON (AP) — A former Ohio bar owner who stormed the U.S. Capitol in a military-style stack formation with fellow members of the far-right Oath Keepers extremist group told jurors Wednesday that it was a “really stupid" decision, saying she got swept up in what seemed to be a "very American moment."

title: Feds, tech fall short on watching extremists, Senate says
shortDescription: The FBI and the Department of Homeland Security are failing to adequately monitor domestic extremists, according to a new Senate report that also faulted social media platforms for encouraging the spread of violent and antigovernment content.

title: Trump seeks White House again amid GOP losses, legal probes
shortDescription: PALM BEACH, Fla. (AP) — Former President Donald Trump on Tuesday launched his third campaign for the White House just one week after a disappointing midterm showing for Republicans, forcing the party to again decide whether to embrace a candidate whose refusal to accept defeat in 2020 sparked an insurrection and pushed American democracy to the brink.

title: Why the AP hasn’t called control of the House yet
shortDescription: The GOP's wait for a U.S. House majority dragged into a second week, as the amount of votes still to be counted after Tuesday in California and elsewhere kept The Associated Press from calling the final seat Republicans need for control.

title: McCarthy passes 1st House speaker test, but hurdles remain
shortDescription: WASHINGTON (AP) — Republican leader Kevin McCarthy won the nomination Tuesday for House speaker, clearing a first step with majority support from his colleagues, but he now faces a weeks-long slog to quell right-flank objections before a final vote in the new year.

title: Fight over election tally threatens Arizona certification
shortDescription: PHOENIX (AP) — The two Republicans who control the elected board in a rural Arizona county have sued their own elections director to force her to conduct a greatly expanded hand-count of ballots cast in the Nov.

title: Florida’s Scott takes on McConnell in bid for Senate leader
shortDescription: WASHINGTON (AP) — Florida Sen. Rick Scott said Tuesday that he will mount a long-shot bid to unseat Senate Republican leader Mitch McConnell, opening the latest front in an intraparty battle between allies of McConnell and former President Donald Trump over the direction of the GOP following a disappointing showing in last week's midterm elections.

title: The week in politics: Republicans take House, Democratic leadership shift
shortDescription: House Speaker Nancy Pelosi announced she was stepping down from Democratic leadership. Donald Trump announced he's running for president. Plus more.

title: Obama say Democrats can thank young voters for their midterm victories
shortDescription: Former President Barack Obama attributed Democratic midterm election wins to a voter base that historically weren't counted on: young voters

title: Ohio Republicans revive bill to change state election laws
shortDescription: A sweeping overhaul to Ohio election law would change voter ID requirements and eliminate in-person early voting the Monday before Election Day.

title: Nancy Pelosi steps down as Speaker of the House
shortDescription: Washington Bureau chief Susan Page reflects on Nancy Pelosi's career after she stepped down from her role as Speaker of the House.

title: Former Trump CFO on verge of tears as he testifies during tax fraud trial
shortDescription: Former President Trump, who recently announced a 2024 White House bid, isn't charged in the case against two of his companies.

title: Biden slams Republicans on student debt plan
shortDescription: President Joe Biden called Republican efforts to block student debt relief "hypocritical."

title: In a disappointing midterm, Republicans still captured the House; How?
shortDescription: The GOP's most high-profile win was ousting New York Rep. Sean Patrick Maloney, who chaired party efforts through the Democratic Congressional Campaign Committee.

title: More Senate Democrats Seek Investigation of Tech Firm Accused of Colluding With Landlords to Hike Apartment Rents
shortDescription: Sen. Amy Klobuchar and other leading Democrats have asked the Department of Justice to examine Texas-based RealPage, which sells software to help landlords set apartment rental prices across the country.

title: “We Need to Defend This Law”: Inside an Anti-Abortion Meeting With Tennessee’s GOP Lawmakers
shortDescription: Anti-abortion groups helped write and pass laws that kicked in to ban abortion when Roe v. Wade was overturned. The groups see Tennessee’s ban as the country’s strongest — and they want to keep it that way, according to audio reviewed by ProPublica.

title: Georgia Senate Rivals, With Little Time to Spare, Sprint Toward Runoff
shortDescription: Herschel Walker and Senator Raphael Warnock have only a few weeks to campaign, and Senate control is no longer at stake — which has both scrambled the race and left it largely unchanged.By Maya King

title: Brooklyn’s in the House. And the Senate.
shortDescription: With Hakeem Jeffries and Chuck Schumer poised to lead the Democrats in Washington, the New York borough that they live in enters the political spotlight.By Dodai Stewart

title: A Georgia judge allows another Saturday of early voting in the Senate runoff, a victory for Democrats.
shortDescription: Democrats had argued that a 2016 state law restricting early voting on a Saturday near a federal holiday, in this case Thanksgiving, would unfairly disenfranchise voters in the state’s runoff election for Senate.By Maya King

title: Hakeem Jeffries, Pressing to Lead Democrats, Marks a Generational Shift
shortDescription: The congressman, who has served in the House for a decade, would be a far different leader from Speaker Nancy Pelosi, whom he is running to succeed.By Nicholas Fandos and Annie Karni

title: N.Y. Democrats Blame Eric Adams for Election Losses. He Doesn’t Care.
shortDescription: The New York City mayor focuses relentlessly on crime, and critics say he lent legitimacy to Republicans who played up the issue in their midterms campaigns.By Emma G. Fitzsimmons and Jeffery C. Mays

title: Pelosi’s Decision to Step Aside Paves Path for a New Generation of Democrats
shortDescription: Representatives Hakeem Jeffries of New York, Katherine Clark of Massachusetts and Pete Aguilar of California were widely expected to seek the top three slots.By Emily Cochrane and Annie Karni

title: Why Republicans’ Wafer-Thin House Majority Is a Gift for Democrats
shortDescription: Democrats would have loved to keep the chamber. But politically, being in the minority will have its benefits.By Blake Hounshell

title: Dems get in array on future leadership after Pelosi departs
shortDescription: Lawmakers have managed to stealthily defuse rivalries for nearly every position at the top of the House caucus, despite their three major leadership retirements.

title: Victorious House Republicans describe plans to investigate Biden
Republicans Paid a Price for Overturning Roe. It May Have Been Worth It.
